setDevice

public void setDevice(java.lang.String device)
Sets the device which has to be used when running tests

Parameters:
device - Valid values are ios, ipad, iphone

setDeviceTarget

public void setDeviceTarget(java.lang.String target)
controls which device to launch on. When set Calabash uses instruments to launch. The default is 'simulator' unless a device is plugged in via USB, in which case it uses that device

Parameters:
target - target to set to

getDeviceTarget

public java.lang.String getDeviceTarget()
Gets the device target

Returns:

getAppBundlePath

public java.lang.String getAppBundlePath()
Gets the APP bundle path

Returns:
path if set, null otherwise

setAppBundlePath

public void setAppBundlePath(java.lang.String appBundlePath)
Sets the APP bundle path. This is required only when calabash fails to auto detect the app bundle path.

Parameters:
appBundlePath - Path to the bundle

setScreenshotListener

public void setScreenshotListener(ScreenshotListener listener)
Sets the screenshot listener. Listener will be invoked whenever calabash takes a screenshot.

Parameters:
listener - ScreenshotListener instance

getScreenshotListener

public ScreenshotListener getScreenshotListener()
Gets the current screenshot listener

Returns:
ScreenshotListener if set, null otherwise

getDeviceEndPoint

public java.net.URI getDeviceEndPoint()
Gets the device endpoint.

Returns:
URI if set, null otherwise

setDeviceEndPoint

public void setDeviceEndPoint(java.net.URI deviceEndPoint)
Sets the device IP address. This is required only when the device that needs to run the test is not in localhost. By default calabash uses http://localhost:37265

Parameters:
deviceEndPoint - A valid device endpoint

getLogsDirectory

public java.io.File getLogsDirectory()
Gets the logs directory

Returns:

setLogsDirectory

public void setLogsDirectory(java.io.File logsDirectory)
                      throws CalabashException
Sets the logs directory. Setting null will disable logging

Parameters:
logsDirectory - Logs directory to set
Throws:
CalabashException - If the directory is invalid or not writable

isLoggingEnabled

public boolean isLoggingEnabled()
Gets the boolean value indicating whether logging is enabled

Returns:
true if logging is enabled, false otherwise

getNoLaunch

public boolean getNoLaunch()
Determines test run should launch the application

Returns:
true if it should launch, false otherwise

setNoLaunch

public void setNoLaunch(boolean noLaunch)
Setting this will stop launching the application every time test starts

Parameters:
noLaunch - true will disable launching

setPauseTime

public void setPauseTime(long pauseTimeInMs)
Sets the pause time in milliseconds. Calabash will pause for the specified seconds after performing every actions

Parameters:
pauseTimeInMs - Milliseconds to wait after each actions

Pause time in milliseconds

setDetectConnectedDevice

public void setDetectConnectedDevice(boolean value)
Setting this to true will enable calabash to search for devices connected via USB. If no devices are connected, setting this will hang the calabash launch

Parameters:
value -

getDetectConnectedDevice

public boolean getDetectConnectedDevice()
Gets a value indicating whether calabash will search for devices connected via USB.

true if enabled, false otherwise

Setting debug will output debug information from calabash to console

value -
